Certificate of PoC antigen test

Attention: Only valid in original and in combination with proof of identity!

Please note that you are required by law to provide truthful information.

The collection of your data will be justified in accordance with the State Ordinance on Coronavirus Control as amended from July 20, 2020. We expressly point out that false information constitutes an administrative offense and may result in at least a fine.

Information requirements according to Art. 13 (1) and (2) Data Protection Regulation (DSGVO)

Purpose of processing, legal basis, legal obligation to collect:

Ensuring effective traceability of infections; there is an obligation to collect contact data according to Art. 6 para. 1 lit. C DSGVO in conjunction with §4 para. 2 of the Land Ordinance (see display) on the revision of the Corona Control Ordinance.

Recipients of the collected contact data:

The contact data must be provided to the competent authority (public health department) upon request, if this is necessary for the follow-up of possible infections. The contact data will be kept for a period of four weeks and then deleted.

Your rights:

As a data subject, you have the right to information regarding the contact data collected, the right to notification, as well as a right to deletion after expiry of the retention period vis-à-vis the person responsible. Use the above contact details of the responsible party to exercise their rights.

There is a right of appeal to the competent data protection supervisory authority.

Land Commissioner for Data Protection, Holstenstraße 98,24103 Kiel, www.datenschutzzentrum.de
